p.s: The excerpt at hands from the play Disgraced, Scene 3 was written by Ayad Akhtar and published in Germany by Westermann in the year 2018.
The play plays in the time of the post 9/11 aeraera in americaAmerica and a is about muslimMuslim pakistaniPakistani who retired his religion but is facing the created islamophobia by 9/11.
The excerpt at hands deals with a dinner of Emily, Jory, Isaac and Amir losing control.
The excerpt starts with Isaac trying to kiss Emily.

They get interrupted by Isaac's wife Jory, who has a conversation with Amir about the job, that she rises up and not Amir as he thought, stops to talk as she sees his husband trying to kiss Emily, the wife of Amir.
When Jory confronts them about what is happening, both of them start abandon their affair.
Amir begins to get angry and gives Jory the responsibility about the looseloss of the chance to rise up in the job and about the affair between Isaac and Emily.
Isaac starts defending Jory and Amir reacts with a spit in Isaac's face.
Shocked by Amir's acting, Isaac calls him and his cultural background animals.
Then Jory tells Amir his father figure in the job (Mort) is retiring and that she is replacing him.
Trying to control himself, Amir walks away.
Emily follows him and he asks her, if this affair between her and Isaac is real.
She confirms, Amir cannot control hisselfhimself anymore and starts punching in her face.
In the moment when he realizes what he has done, the door opens and his nephew Abe enters, sees Emily laying on the ground with a bloody face and Amir standing next to her.
